document_api_meta.title: Get Creator Sample Application Detail
document_api_meta.env_desc: Get the sample detail of specified sample application.

request_header_param.name: x-tts-access-token
request_header_param.desc: The creator access_token value from [Get Access Token](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/678e3a3292b0f40314a92d75#Get%20Access%20Token%20API), when user_type = 1. Follow this [guide](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/678e3a362dccb8030ea6f98c) to get creator access_token.

request_query_param.name: app_key
request_query_param.desc: Every single app will have a unique key. Please use the specific key assigned to your app.

request_query_param.name: sign
request_query_param.desc: Signature generated by gen algorithm. When you send API requests to TTS, you must sign them so that TTS can identify the senders.

request_query_param.name: timestamp
request_query_param.desc: Unix timestamp GMT (UTC+00:00). This timestamp is used across all API requests. Developers can use this convert to local time.

request_body_param.name: application_id
request_body_param.desc: Free sample application ID, required when application type is "FREE_SAMPLE".

request_body_param.name: application_type
request_body_param.desc:
The type of creator sample application.
- FREE_SAMPLE : free sample supplied by seller which creator can apply for by themselves from product detail page.
- SAMPLE_COUPON: creator claimed sample coupon (a type of coupon) and used it to place orders at a discount price.
- SAMPLE_CAMPAIGN: activity organized by the platform. Creators can participate in this activity to obtain sample products provided by the platform for free.

request_body_param.name: main_order_id
request_body_param.desc: The real main order identifier, required when application  is "SAMPLE_COUPON"  or "SAMPLE_CAMPAIGN" or "REFUNDABLE_SAMPLE".

response_param.name: code
response_param.desc: The success or failure status code returned in API response.

response_param.name: message
response_param.desc: The success or failure messages returned in API response. Reasons of failure will be described in the message.

response_param.name: request_id
response_param.desc: Request log

response_param.name: data
response_param.desc: Specific return information

response_param.name: ^sample_application
response_param.desc: The sample application information.

response_param.name: ^^id
response_param.desc: Sample application identifier.

response_param.name: ^^create_time
response_param.desc: Sample application create time in seconds.

response_param.name: ^^sample_product
response_param.desc: The sample product information.

response_param.name: ^^^id
response_param.desc: The product identifier.

response_param.name: ^^^sku_id
response_param.desc: The SKU identifier.

response_param.name: ^^^sku_sale_property_value_names
response_param.desc: Sku property name list for this sku id.

response_param.name: ^^main_order_id
response_param.desc: The sample order is generated after the sample application is approved by seller.

response_param.name: ^^activity_id
response_param.desc: The sample activity identifier id( only for sample campaign).

response_param.name: ^^type
response_param.desc:
The type of creator sample application.
- FREE_SAMPLE : free sample supplied by seller which creator can apply by themselves from pdp page.
- SAMPLE_COUPON: creator claimed sample coupon (a type of coupon) and used it to purchase orders at a discount price.
- SAMPLE_CAMPAIGN: activity organized by the platform. Creators can participate in this activity to obtain sample products provided by the platform for free.

response_param.name: ^^status
response_param.desc:
The status of sample applications.
The possible enumerated values are:
- PENDING: The sample application is waiting for the seller's review.
- AWAITING_SHIPMENT: The application is approved, and the seller needs to ship the sample.
- SHIPPED: The sample has been shipped by the seller and is waiting for the creator to receive the package.
- CONTENT_PENDING: The creator has received the sample package and is expected to create content.
- REJECT_CANCELLED: The sample application has been rejected by the seller.
- OVERDUE_CANCELLED: The sample application has expired due to being overdue.
- UNFULFILL_CANCELLED: The creator did not fulfill the commitment to create content within the agreed timeframe.
- SELLER_NOT_SHIP_CANCELLED: The seller did not ship the sample within the required timeframe.
- WITHDRAW_CANCELLED: The creator withdrew the sample application before the seller approved it.
- UNFULFILLABLE_CANCELLED: The application was cancelled due to reasons beyond the creator's control, making it impossible to create content.
- OPS_CANCELLED: The application was manually cancelled by operations staff.
- OPS_FAILED: The application was marked as failed by operations staff.
- OPS_ COMPLETED: The application was manually marked as completed by operations staff.
- COMPLETED: The application is complete, and the creator has posted the content.
This field allows for tracking the status of a sample application throughout its lifecycle, providing visibility into each stage of the process for sellers and creators.

response_param.name: ^^creator_fulfillment
response_param.desc: Fulfillment info for this sample application.

response_param.name: ^^^id
response_param.desc: Fulfillment identifier.

response_param.name: ^^^expiration_time
response_param.desc: Fulfillment deadline timestamp, in seconds.

response_param.name: ^^^total_suspend_duration
response_param.desc: Total suspension duration for fulfillment, in seconds.

response_param.name: ^^^status
response_param.desc:
Fulfillment status, It indicates the current status of the fulfillment process. The possible values are:
- PENDING: The creator is yet to fulfill the content creation obligation.
- ONGOING: Fulfillment is in progress; content has been created and is being evaluated against criteria.
- SUCCEED: Fulfillment has been successfully completed; the content meets the required standards.
- FAILED: Fulfillment failed; the content did not meet the required standards.
- OVERDUE: Fulfillment is overdue; the creator did not meet the deadline.
- SUSPEND: Fulfillment has been suspended.
- CANCELLED: Fulfillment has been cancelled, either by the creator or due to operational reasons.
- EXEMPTED: The creator has been exempted from the fulfillment obligation.

error_code_list.msg: Internal error. Please try again. If the issue persists after multiple attempts, please contact platform support.

sample_code.label: Go
Node.js
Java

scope_list.package_description: The application will be able to get details regarding your collaborations, including searching collaborations, tracking collaboration performance, receiving collaboration detaiIs and updates, and querying sample applications and related fulfillment details.
scope_list.auth_info: The application will be able to get your collaborations, including getting the collaboration, searching collaborations, tracking collaboration performance, receiving collaboration updates, and getting sample distribution.
